## DisruptionManager.search() method

Search the disruptions

**Signature:**

```typescript
search(since_date?: Date, until_date?: Date): Promise<Disruption[]>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

since\_date


</td><td>

Date


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Defines the start date of the disruptions to search for


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

until\_date


</td><td>

Date


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Defines the end date of the disruptions to search for


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[Disruption](./sncf.js.disruption.md)<!-- -->\[\]&gt;

## Example

This example shows all the disruptions from yesterday to today

```javascript
const {Client} = require('SNCF.js');

const client = new Client();
client.disruptions.search(new Date(Date.now() - 86400000), new Date())
   .then(disruptions => {
   console.log(disruptions)
   })
   .catch(console.error)
```
